entry.title: Understanding Type Coercion in JavaScript
entry.summary: JavaScript lets you mix and match types quite happily, and in most cases the result might be exactly what you expect:

entry.title: Multivariable linear regression in Python
entry.summary: Multivariable linear regression is all about taking in a set of data points (x0, x1, …,xn, y) and to be able to predict y values for some other data points (x0',x1',…,xn'). I'm giving an example here on how to do so in Python as well as computing the coefficient of determination (R2) to see how well the predictor variables model y.

entry.title: Using the Visitor pattern in C++17
entry.summary: In C++17, the std::variant and how it fit's into the Visitor pattern.

entry.title: Making it to the front page on StackOverflow
entry.summary: As we all know StackOverflow can be an intimidating place for new users, as any mistakes are quickly picked up, critcised and questions are closed. You also see the same group of people quick to answer questions (See here for a user answering over 85,000 questions in SQL.) But what if I told you it's possible to hit the front page of StackOverflow within a month.
